result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher L Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher L Johnson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christopher L Johnson was found guilty of Issue of Worthless Checks (>$2500), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(2).
  • Christopher L Johnson was found guilty of Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Both counts are Concurrent with each other, with same conditions also concurrent
.

miscConds.notes:
Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess drugs or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician

Random testing will be up to PO's discretion
.

Pay restitution & 10% surcharge - amount to be determined

Restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to be established with the PO but calling for no less than 2.5% of gross wages to be paid toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignment

Take all prescribed medications as directed

Complete any other conditions or programming deemed necessary by the PO

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

Credit for 3 days if probation is ever revoked

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

supervisions.notes:
During period of prison incarceration, 25% of defendant's prison inmate funds are to be applied to restitution owed
.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any sentence the defendant is currently serving
.

superMiscConds.notes:
Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol, drugs or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing
.

Take all prescribed medications as directed

Comply with treatment and recommendations from Behavioral Health

Complete any other treatment deemed necessary by the PO

Pay restitution and court costs/fees as originally ordered

Pay DOC Supervision fees

If extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

supervisions.notes:
.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to Ct 1 of this case
.

- Extended Supervision is 1 year w/ conditions:  No alcohol, drugs or cont subs w/o valid prescription, w/ random testing;  Complete AODA & follow-thru w/ trmt recommended;  Comply w/ Behavioral Health trmt & recommendations;  Take all prescribed meds as directed;  Pay restitution as originally ordered;  Pay CRT costs/fees as originally ordered;  Pay DOC fees

O'Neill:  Today the plan is to only resolve 14CF-688.
Amended Information filed.  Statement as to Negotiated Plea filed - signed/understands
Count 1 - Fel Issue Worthless Checks  943.24(2) and 939.50(3)(i)   GUILTY    Count 2 - Misd Issue Worthless Checks as a Repeater  943.24(1) and 939.51(3)(a) and .62 (1)(a)  GUILTY   Counts 3-6  Dismissed   10-14-54616  Bail-Jumping - declined but read-in
Plea Questionnaire filed - signed/understands.  Rights/elements questions gone over.  No voting or firearms advised.  The victim rights act has been complied with.  No promises/threats.  Mr. Johnson states what happend on those days.
COURT finds the pleas are F, V & I made.  Sufficient factual basis.  Found guilty and convicted.
Suleski recommends probation.  O'Neil asks that probation not be for more than 2 years...  Johnson comments.  Court comments.
Sentence withheld on each count

1 year probation on  count 2 - concurrent with count 1
